title: Citi Foundation Action for Racial Equity
tag-2: In 2020, Citi and the Citi Foundation announced Action for Racial Equity, a comprehensive set of strategic initiatives to help close the racial wealth gap and increase economic mobility in the U.S. As part of this effort, the Citi Foundation provided $100 million in grants to support community change agents addressing issues of racial equity.
tag-3: The Citi Foundation’s Action for Racial Equity investments built on a long history of support to community organizations that work to help level the playing field for people of color in the U.S.
tag-4: The Citi Foundation is a founding supporter of Living Cities’ Closing the Gaps Network.
tag-5: Citi Foundation supported the Joint Center’s Data for Black America project, which aims to increase understanding of the needs of Black communities.
tag-6: In 2020, the Citi Foundation committed $3 million to support the next phase of the Financial Health Pulse Initiative to help highlight the economic disparities and financial health across communities in the U.S.
tag-7: In 2021, the Citi Foundation expanded support to Echoing Green for their work to create a more inclusive social entrepreneurship sector.
tag-8: Citi Foundation supported the Thurgood Marshall College Fund in 2021 to launch the HBCU Career Incubator Program.
